Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship covers full tuition fees (provided as a fee offset), a living allowance (stipend), and research support.
Stipend Rate (2024): Approximately AUD 37,000 per year for up to 2 years for Master's students and 3.5 years for PhD students.
Stipend Rate (2025): Approximately AUD 38,500 per year (pro rata, full-time study rate) for Master's by Research students.
Quantity: Approximately 600 Graduate Research Scholarships are awarded annually
Eligibility_Criteria: Available to high-achieving domestic and international students. Must be undertaking a Masters by Research degree or a doctoral degree (PhD) at the University of Melbourne. Applicants must be either enrolling in a graduate research degree or currently enrolled in a research course at the University of Melbourne. Selection is primarily based on academic merit, academic results from prior study, and demonstrated research potential in the applicant's field of study. Candidates are ranked highest by relevant selection panels.
Min_Gpa: WAM: around 80 for admission to a graduate research course; WAM: at least 85 for domestic scholarship consideration; WAM: around 90 for international scholarship consideration; GPA: 3.6 for Master's scholarships
Language_Certificate: IELTS: Overall score of 7.0 (with a written score of 7.0 and no band less than 6.0). TOEFL: Overall score of 94+ (with a writing score of 27, speaking 18, and reading & listening 13). Other Accepted Tests: Pearson English Test, Cambridge English, Certificate of Advanced English (CAE).
Other_Requirements: Demonstrated research potential in their chosen field of study. Building a strong Academic CV that highlights relevant achievements.
Scholarship_Info: The Melbourne Research Scholarship (MRS) is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the University of Melbourne, Australia. It is designed to support high-achieving domestic and international students pursuing graduate research degrees. The MRS is often referred to interchangeably with the broader University of Melbourne Graduate Research Scholarships and Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships, indicating a unified approach to graduate research funding at the institution. This scholarship is significantly supported by the Australian Commonwealth Government.
Application_Documents:
Academic Referee Report(s)
Academic CV
Relevant publications (if applicable)
Timeline:
2025-10-31 : Application Deadline for 2026 intake (for new applicants applying for a graduate research course and current students applying for a scholarship)
Around course offer time : Scholarship offers made

Scholarship_Name: University of Sydney Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
RTP Scholarships include RTP Fees Offset, RTP Stipends, and RTP Allowances, provided to Higher Degree by Research (HDR) students.
The scholarship is comprehensive, covering full tuition fees, living expenses, relocation costs, health cover, and thesis costs. It also includes an annual stipend to support living expenses.
Duration: RTP scholarships are available for a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years for full-time research doctorate students. For part-time research doctorate students, the scholarship can last for a minimum of 6 years up to a maximum of 8 years.
Eligibility_Criteria:
The scholarship is available to both domestic and international postgraduate research students.
Applicants must be enrolled in or undertaking an accredited Research Higher Degree (HDR) at the University of Sydney.
Awarded to students demonstrating exceptional research potential to undertake a higher degree by research. Students are required to show exceptional academic performance and strong research potential.
Eligible to undertake a Postgraduate Research Degree or Master’s by Research program.
Applicants must apply and be considered for the Research Training Program (RTP) Stipend Scholarships.
Must meet the English language proficiency requirements established by the University of Sydney.
Applicants must demonstrate very good grades and exceptional academic performance.
Completion of a relevant prior degree is mandatory: a Bachelor's degree for Master's applicants, and a Master's degree for PhD applicants. The applicant must be undertaking a higher degree by research (HDR).
A minimum of six months of relevant supervised research experience with outstanding results is generally expected, potentially gained as part of a Master's degree.
Applicants must meet the English language proficiency standards established by the University of Sydney.
Experience_Years: A minimum of six months of relevant supervised research experience with outstanding results is generally expected
Language_Certificate: Required, specific tests/scores not detailed in report
Other_Requirements:
Strong referee letters are required, preferably from academics who have worked directly with the applicant on research.
Applicants are encouraged to highlight achievements that make them stand out, such as authorship of a peer-reviewed journal paper, or having won notable prizes and commendations in academic studies.
An application for admission to a research degree at the University of Sydney must be submitted concurrently or prior to the scholarship application. Applicants may receive a conditional scholarship offer without having yet received an admission offer, but a firm scholarship offer will only be granted once an unconditional admission offer has been secured.
Scholarship_Info: The Research Training Program (RTP) scholarships are a prestigious initiative by the Australian Government to provide financial assistance to high-achieving domestic and international postgraduate research students. These scholarships aim to support students of exceptional research potential in undertaking higher degrees by research at Australian universities like the University of Sydney. The program is governed by the Commonwealth Scholarships Guidelines (Research) 2017, ensuring a standardized yet university-managed application and selection process.
Application_Documents:
All required documents for both the program application and the RTP scholarship application must be submitted.
Research Experience Evidence Template (RE Form).
Timeline:
2025-01-30 : Opening Date
2025-05-05 : Application Deadline for Research Period 3 & 4, 2025
2025-06-24 : Outcome Notification for applications submitted by May 5, 2025
2025-09-12 : Application Deadline for Research Period 1 and 2, 2026
2025-12-30 : General closing date for some applications

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The Gates Cambridge Scholarship is a full-cost scholarship, covering all expenses associated with studying at the University of Cambridge.
*   Full University Composition Fee (tuition)
*   A maintenance allowance of £21,000 per year (for 12 months, pro rata for shorter courses).
*   One economy single airfare at both the beginning and end of the course.
*   Inbound visa costs and the cost of the Immigration Health Surcharge.
*   Maintenance allowance during fieldwork (for PhD scholars, though the Trust does not fund other fieldwork costs, which are expected to be covered by the academic department).
*   Discretionary funding for academic development (e.g., conference attendance, research materials) and hardship.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be citizens of any country outside the United Kingdom. Candidates should be seniors or recent college graduates with evidence of academic excellence, typically including a strong undergraduate degree (e.g., a good 2:1 honours degree or equivalent) and often additional postgraduate study. Must be applying to pursue one of the following full-time residential postgraduate degrees at the University of Cambridge: PhD (doctoral degree), MSc or MLitt (Master of Science or Letters), One-year postgraduate courses (e.g., MPhil, LLM, MASt, Diploma, MBA, etc.). Applicants must first gain admission to their chosen postgraduate course at the University of Cambridge. Must meet the University of Cambridge's English language requirements. Candidates should normally be under the age of 30 (maximum age 30). Financial need is not a requirement for this scholarship.
Min_Gpa: Minimum GPA of 3.5/4.0 or 3.8/4.0 (equivalent to a good 2:1 honours degree).
Language_Certificate: Required if English is not the applicant's first language. IELTS Academic 7.5 (with a minimum of 7.0 in all individual components) or TOEFL Internet-based Test (iBT) 110 (with a minimum of 25 or higher in all components).
Special_Circumstances: A pilot scheme allows applicants to apply for funding for a part-time doctoral degree (PhD) for October 2024 entry. The scholarship does not typically fund degrees in business.
Other_Requirements: Current Cambridge students applying for a new postgraduate course (e.g., MPhil to PhD) are eligible. Current Gates Cambridge Scholars may apply for a second scholarship if they are applying for a new degree. However, applicants already part-way through a course cannot apply to fund the remainder of it. Selection is based on four key criteria: Academic excellence, Reasons for choice of course, A commitment to improving the lives of others, and Leadership potential. Applicants must provide references, including a specific "Gates Cambridge Reference" in addition to typically two academic references. PhD applicants are required to submit a Research Proposal. All candidates are assessed on their "fit" with the scholarship's mission, their reasons for choosing their course, and their commitment to improving the lives of others, demonstrating leadership potential.
Scholarship_Info: The Gates Cambridge Scholarship is a highly prestigious, fully funded postgraduate scholarship program established in October 2000 by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Its mission is to build a global network of future leaders committed to improving the lives of others. The scholarship enables outstanding applicants from countries outside the UK to pursue a full-time (or, in a pilot scheme, part-time doctoral) postgraduate degree in almost any subject at the University of Cambridge, UK.
Application_Documents: Transcripts, references (including the specific Gates Cambridge Reference), Research Proposal (for PhD applicants). Applicants may also need to submit a PDF of their online form and writing components.
Timeline:
September each year : Application Opening Date
October 15, 2025 : Application Deadline (US Citizens resident in the USA)
December 3, 2025 OR January 7, 2026 : Application Deadline (Other Applicants (International))

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
*   Tuition Fees: Full coverage of tuition costs for the duration of the degree.
*   Living Allowance (Stipend): A generous stipend to assist with living expenses. The annual stipend amount is reported as either AUD $36,063 or AUD $35,013.
*   Relocation Allowance: An allowance is provided for eligible students to assist with relocation costs.
*   Research Costs: Support for expenses directly related to the student's research project.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to both domestic and international students undertaking Research Master's or PhD programs at Monash University's Australian campuses. Current Monash students are also eligible. Selection is based on academic record, research outputs, and prior research experience. Applicants must maintain a WAM of 70 each semester to retain the scholarship. Strong academic record expected. Typically requires a Bachelor's degree with at least four years of full-time study in a relevant field, or an equivalent qualification (Honours 1 or 2A). English language proficiency required. No age or gender limits.
Min_Gpa: Not specified for initial application; WAM of 70 (Monash scale) required for scholarship continuation.
Experience_Years: No minimum years specified; research and relevant work experience are valuable.
Language_Certificate: IELTS (overall 6.5, no band less than 6.0), TOEFL (overall 79+ with specific section minimums). Specific requirements may vary by course.
Other_Requirements: Demonstrated research outputs (publications), prior research experience, and a personal statement outlining reasons for pursuing the scholarship and research interests are considered.
Scholarship_Info: The Monash Graduate Scholarship (MGS) is a prestigious, centrally controlled, and fully funded scholarship offered by Monash University in Australia. It is designed to support both domestic and international students who are undertaking Research Master's and PhD programs at Monash University's Australian campuses. It is a flagship offering aimed at attracting high-calibre research students.
Application_Documents:
*   Passport (for international applicants)
*   Academic Transcripts
*   Detailed Research Proposal
*   Two Letters of Recommendation
*   Information about Work Experience
*   Information about Research Experience
*   Letter of Motivation
*   Candidate Publications/Research Outputs (if applicable)
*   English Language Proficiency Test Scores (IELTS/TOEFL)
Timeline: 2025-03-31 : Application Deadline (International Round 1), 2025-05-31 : Application Deadline (Domestic Round 2), 2025-06-01 : Application Opening Date (Domestic Round 4), 2025-09-01 : Application Opening Date (International Round 1), 2025-10-31 : Application Deadline (2025-2026 Round), 2025-11-01 : Application Opening Date (Domestic Round 2)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The UCL-RES scholarship provides comprehensive financial support, covering full tuition fees (for either Home or Overseas students) and a maintenance stipend. The maintenance stipend is adjusted annually to account for inflation, ensuring its value is maintained throughout the research programme.
Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fees (Home or Overseas rates)
*   Maintenance stipend
*   Additional research costs of up to £1,200 per year for the stated duration of the research portion of the programme.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to outstanding scholars from any country. Both prospective and current UCL doctoral students are eligible to apply. Candidates must undertake a full programme of doctoral research (MPhil/PhD or EngD) at UCL, either full-time or part-time. Distance-learning programs are not eligible; students must attend UCL in person. Applicants must have submitted a completed admission application to, or currently be registered on, an eligible degree programme at UCL by the scholarship deadline. An offer of a place at UCL is not required to apply for the scholarship, but a complete UCL research application must be submitted.
Min_Gpa: UK first-class honours degree or a very good second-class honours degree, or international equivalent.
Language_Certificate: IELTS: 6.5 overall (with a minimum of 6.0 in each section), TOEFL: 92 overall. Other language certificates may be accepted; applicants should check UCL's general admission requirements.
Other_Requirements: Referees should demonstrate personal knowledge of the candidate, confirm their outstanding promise and research potential, and verify that the candidate has obtained or is predicted to obtain a first-class or a very good second-class honours degree or its equivalent. Students must attend UCL in person; distance-learning programs are not eligible.
Scholarship_Info: The UCL Research Excellence Scholarship (UCL-RES) is a prestigious award designed to attract outstanding scholars globally to undertake full-time or part-time doctoral research at University College London. For the 2025/26 academic year, UCL is offering up to 40 fully funded scholarships to exceptional applicants from any country. The UCL-RES is a flagship scholarship programme aimed at attracting and supporting the most talented doctoral researchers from around the world, fostering a vibrant research environment at UCL.
Application_Documents:
While not explicitly detailed as a list for the scholarship itself, a complete UCL research application typically includes:
*   Academic transcripts and degree certificates.
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV).
*   Research proposal.
*   Reference letters (specifically tailored to highlight research potential and academic excellence for the scholarship).
*   A specific UCL-RES scholarship application form (submitted to the department).
Timeline: Now open for the 2025-26 academic year : Scholarship Status, 2025-10-24 : Primary Application Deadline (2025-26 Academic Year), 2025-11-23 : Departmental Application Deadline (for September 2026 entry), 2026-01-09 : General Closing Date (for 2026 entry)

Funding_Level: Fixed Amount, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details: The scholarship provides $40,000 per year for a duration of 36 months (three years). The funding is intended to cover a range of expenses, including tuition fees, living expenses, and research-related costs. This support aims to enable recipients to participate fully in academic conferences, publications, and outreach activities without undue financial burden.
Quantity: SSHRC alone has awarded 458 doctoral scholarships; total number across all three agencies varies by competition.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be a Canadian citizen, a permanent resident of Canada, or a Protected Person under subsection 95(2) of the *Immigration and Refugee Protection Act* (Canada) by the application deadline. Up to 15% of awards across Canada are available to international applicants; if not a Canadian citizen, permanent resident, or protected person, they must be enrolled in their doctoral program of study at an eligible Canadian institution by the application deadline. Applicants must be registered in a degree program at an eligible Canadian institution (e.g., at any time between January 1 and December 31 in the year of application) or be on an approved leave of absence. The eligible doctoral program must be predominantly research-oriented, leading to the completion of a thesis, major research project, dissertation, or scholarly work. By December 31 of the calendar year of application, applicants must have completed no more than 36 months of full-time equivalent study in the doctoral program for which funding is requested. A maximum of one Canada Graduate Research Scholarship – Master's (CGRS M) or Canada Graduate Research Scholarship – Doctoral (CGRS D) application can be submitted per competition year. Applications must be submitted through the correct channel, either through a Canadian institution with a doctoral award quota or directly to the relevant agency (SSHRC allows direct applications in certain cases).
Eligible_Fields: Biomedical research, Clinical research, Health services research
Eligible_Field_Group: Healthcare & Medicine, Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Humanities & Social Sciences
Min_Gpa: Not specified by CGS-D program; typically 3.0/4.0 or 80%/A- for PhD admission.
Experience_Years: No minimum years of work experience are specified.
Language_Certificate: No specific language test requirement for the scholarship itself; however, candidates must possess sufficient proficiency in English or French for doctoral studies, often a prerequisite for graduate admission at Canadian universities.
Special_Circumstances: Students on an approved leave of absence from their degree program are eligible to apply.
Other_Requirements: Referees are required as part of the application process. International applicants must secure a study permit to live in Canada during their PhD studies.
Scholarship_Info: The Canada Graduate Scholarships – Doctoral (CGS-D) program is a prestigious federal initiative designed to recognize and support Canada's next generation of outstanding innovators, knowledge workers, creative thinkers, and researchers. Administered by Canada's three federal granting agencies—the Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR), the Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC), and the Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council (SSHRC)—this program provides substantial financial support for a high-quality research training experience. Its overarching goal is to foster significant impacts both within and beyond the research environment, thereby promoting Canadian research excellence.
Application_Documents:
The appropriate agency’s online application form.
A Request for First Instalment Form (to be uploaded after award notification).
Official transcripts from all post-secondary institutions attended, including original transcripts for any transfer credits. Failure to include original transcripts for transfer credits may deem an application ineligible.
Free-form documents, which must adhere to specific presentation standards outlined by the agencies.
A detailed proposed research description that clearly aligns with the mandate of the chosen granting agency.
A section to discuss relevant work experience and its benefits to the proposed research.
Reference Letters.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded postgraduate award for 2-3 years of study.
Covered Expenses:
* University of Oxford course fees
* Tuition
* Fees
* Annual stipend for living expenses (living allowance)
* Travel expenses to and from the UK
* Visa application fees
* Health insurance
* The fee required to apply to study at the University of Oxford (covered by the Rhodes Trust after scholarship selection)
Quantity: United States: 32 Scholarships, Canada: 11 Scholarships, Australia: 9 Scholarships, India: 6 Scholarships, China: 4 Scholarships, Southern Africa: 10 Scholarships, West Africa: 3 Scholarships, East Africa: 2 Scholarships, Germany: 2 Scholarships, Global: 2 Scholarships, Israel: 2 Scholarships, Kenya: 2 Scholarships, Pakistan: 2 Scholarships, Saudi Arabia: 2 Scholarships, Zambia: 2 Scholarships, Zimbabwe: 2 Scholarships, Bermuda: 1 Scholarship, Commonwealth Caribbean: 1 Scholarship, Hong Kong: 1 Scholarship, Jamaica: 1 Scholarship, Malaysia: 1 Scholarship, Singapore: 1 Scholarship
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must generally hold citizenship or permanent residency of the relevant country or region. For US applicants, eligibility extends to US citizens, lawful permanent residents (who have resided in the US continuously for the five years prior to the application deadline), and DACA recipients. Selection is made without regard to gender. The scholarship is not conferred until the applicant's admission to Oxford University is confirmed. Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration: This option may be available for applicants who have strong connections to multiple Rhodes constituencies but do not meet the nationality or citizenship criteria for any single one.
Min_Gpa: 3.7/4.0 for institutional endorsement (US applicants); successful applicants typically 3.8/4.0 or higher.
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of professional experience are mandated.
Age: Typically, applicants must be aged 18-23 on October 1st of the application year (e.g., born after October 1, 2001, and before October 2, 2007, for 2026 entry). Some constituencies may allow applicants up to age 24. US citizens may be eligible up to age 27 under specific conditions.
Special_Circumstances: DACA students are eligible to apply for the US Rhodes Scholarship. Inter-Jurisdictional Consideration is available for applicants with strong connections to multiple constituencies but who do not meet the nationality/citizenship criteria for any single one.
Career_Plan: Candidates must describe their immediate plans upon completion of the scholarship and articulate how two years of study at Oxford would enhance these plans (maximum 150 words).
Other_Requirements:
Institutional Endorsement: Required for applicants from the US, Canada, and for the Global Rhodes Scholarship. Many universities have early campus deadlines for this endorsement.
Oxford Course Engagement: It is highly recommended for candidates to get in touch with degree programs or faculty within their proposed program of study at the University of Oxford to demonstrate commitment.
Personal Statement Integrity: The Personal Statement must be certified by the applicant as wholly truthful and their own work, with no assistance received.
Broad Perspective: Applicants are encouraged to spend time developing a broad perspective on their area of study.
Residency/Education for US Applicants: US applicants must apply from their state of legal residence or from where they have received two years of college training and a bachelor’s degree before October 1st.
Scholarship_Info: The Rhodes Scholarship is a prestigious, fully-funded postgraduate award enabling talented young people from around the world to pursue full-time study at the University of Oxford in the United Kingdom. Established with the aim of gathering young leaders, it offers a life-changing opportunity for scholars to join an outstanding global community.
Application_Documents:
The application typically requires a comprehensive set of documents, including:
* Contact information
* Evidence of eligibility (e.g., proof of citizenship or permanent residence)
* University transcripts
* Proposed Oxford course(s)
* Curriculum Vitae (CV)
* Academic Statement
* Personal Statement (often not exceeding 1,000 words)
* 5-8 letters of recommendation
* List of principal activities
* Clear headshot photograph
* Post Scholarship Plan (150 words max)
* Institutional endorsement (where required)
* Evidence of English Language Proficiency

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Fully funded by the UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO).
Covered Expenses:
* Approved tuition fees
* Approved airfare (outward and return)
* Living allowance stipend (approximately £1,347 per month)
* General living expenses
Quantity: PhD Scholarships: 81-200 (average 128) annually; All postgraduate/professional programs: 750-800 annually
Eligibility_Criteria: Must be citizens of Commonwealth countries, specifically from least developed countries and vulnerable states, as classified by the OECD Development Assistance Committee (DAC). Must have been living in an eligible Commonwealth country for a period of two years prior to the application submission date. Scholarships are aimed at those who could not otherwise afford to study in the UK. Applicants must demonstrate the potential to make a positive development impact in their home countries and a strong commitment to sustainable development. Must be eligible to begin a full-time doctoral study program at an approved UK university.
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Healthcare & Medicine, Economics & Business, Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Security & Defense, Agriculture & Environment, Social Services & Care, Education & Training
Min_Gpa: Not specified (excellent academic standing mandatory); HEC Pakistan: 60/100 in HAT test
Experience_Years: Not required (for PhD scholarship, but community contributions strengthened by relevant professional or voluntary experience)
Special_Circumstances: Citizenship from least developed/vulnerable Commonwealth countries (OECD DAC classified); Residency in eligible Commonwealth country for 2 years prior to application; Demonstrated financial need
Career_Plan: Required, demonstrating positive development impact in home country
Other_Requirements: At least two strong references (on official letterhead and signed); Must have secured at least two admissions from UK universities; Supporting statement from a prospective UK Supervisor is required for PhD candidates; Applicants are required to list three potential supervisors from three different UK universities in their application; The CSC does not accept direct applications, applicants must apply through a national nominating agency in their home country or a UK university.
Scholarship_Info: The Commonwealth PhD Scholarships, provided by the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission (CSC) in the UK and funded by the UK Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO), offer fully funded opportunities for doctoral study in the UK. These prestigious scholarships target high-calibre individuals from least developed countries and vulnerable states within the Commonwealth who demonstrate the potential to contribute significantly to the sustainable development of their home countries. The program aims to enhance individual teaching and research capacity, increase institutional capacity in Commonwealth countries, and foster international collaboration. They are tenable at any approved UK university or higher education institution with which the CSC has a part-funding agreement for a specific program of research, for 36 months of full-time study.
Application_Documents:
* Completed online application form (printed copy for records).
* Detailed academic CV.
* At least two admissions from UK Universities.
* At least two references (on letterhead and signed).
* Supporting statement from a prospective UK Supervisor (for PhD candidates).
* Admission letters (where required).
* English language test certificates (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL, PTE).
* HAT test score (if applicable, for HEC Pakistan applicants).
Timeline:
September 2025 : Application Opening (for 2026/2027 academic year)
2025-10-14 : Application Deadline
After 2025-10-14 (approx.) : Selection Notification (provisional)
September/October 2026 : Study Start Date

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Duration: Students are fully funded for four years, within a five-year program support period.
Stipend: A generous starting stipend of £19,900 per year is provided, as set by the Wellcome Trust.
University Fees: All university fees are covered.
Additional Costs:
    Student Visa and Immigration Health Surcharge costs are reimbursed.
    Up to £1,500 per year can be provided for students for other expenses.
Quantity: Each programme: not more than 5 students annually. Wellcome Trust-NIH PhD scholarships: approximately 39 over 8 years.
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be a graduate or student who has, or expects to obtain, a degree (or equivalent). Dedicated programmes exist for health professionals, offering them outstanding research training in supportive and inclusive research environments.
Eligible_Fields: Mental Health Research, Molecular Biology, Genetics, Epidemiology, Medicine, Stem Cell Biology, Public Health, Economics, Biology
Eligible_Field_Group: Healthcare & Medicine, Social Services & Care, Natural Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business
Min_Gpa: Above 60% (equivalent to GPA above 3.3) for unclassified degrees; Minimum upper-second class (2.1) honours degree
Experience_Years: Not specified, but relevant research/work experience is beneficial.
Language_Certificate: IELTS Academic: minimum score of 6.5, with at least 5.5 in each part of the exam. TOEFL: minimum score of 90. Pearson test scores are also accepted. Scores must be taken no earlier than two years before the course start date.
Career_Plan: To produce graduates who are data literate and skilled in the quantitative aspects of biological research.
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters: Referees should clearly state the applicant's name and the specific Wellcome Trust 4-year PhD programme they are applying for, and detail how they know the applicant and for how long. Applicants must satisfy standard university academic and English language entry criteria.
Scholarship_Info: The "Wellcome Trust Four-year PhD Programmes" are prestigious scholarship opportunities provided by the Wellcome Trust. These programmes facilitate collaborative PhD training at academic laboratories across the UK and the Republic of Ireland, and in some cases, at the National Institutes of Health (NIH). They aim to offer graduates outstanding training in scientific research within supportive and inclusive research environments.
Application_Documents:
A covering letter clearly stating the application for the Wellcome Trust four-year PhD programme.
A section on research interests (maximum 200 words).
A section on relevant research/work experience (maximum 200 words).
A personal statement.
Certified proof of GPA/scores.
Timeline:
Annually : Applications open for October entry in subsequent year
2025-08-04 : Application Deadline for Exeter GW4CAT (2026 start)
2025-11-27 : Application Deadline for Wellcome Sanger Institute (2026 intake)
October each year : Annual student uptake

Scholarship_Name: DAAD Doctoral Programmes in Germany (Research Grants)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
A monthly grant ranging from 861 to 1,200 euros, depending on the applicant's qualifications.
Funding for a full doctoral degree is provided for a maximum of four years. The exact length of the funding period is determined by a selection committee based on the project and study plan.
For research projects during a doctorate, funding is available for 2 to 12 months.
All funding must commence in 2026.
If deemed necessary by DAAD, a German language course (2, 4, or 6 months) may be funded prior to the research stay in Germany.
DAAD scholarship PhD and Master's programs generally do not cover tuition fees, but they comprehensively fund living costs and other essential expenses.
Covered Expenses:
- Living expenses
- Research costs
- Health insurance
- Accident insurance
- Personal liability insurance
- Travel costs
- Language preparation (if applicable)
Eligibility_Criteria:
Applicants must be foreign graduates from developed and newly industrialized countries, representing all academic disciplines.
Non-German citizenship and residence outside Germany are mandatory.
Highly qualified doctoral candidates who are early in their academic/professional careers, or individuals aspiring to earn a doctoral degree in Germany, are eligible.
Applicants with a Master’s degree (or, in exceptional cases, an outstanding Bachelor’s degree) and strong academic records are encouraged to apply.
MS and PhD applicants may apply, though eligibility for Master's programs can be country-specific.
The scholarship for this program is restricted to certain specified countries.
Min_Gpa: DAAD generally expects a minimum GPA of 2.5 on the German scale, which roughly translates to 75% or a GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale. For top-tier programs, higher academic performance is often required. Some sources also mention a requirement to maintain a GPA of 9/10 throughout undergraduate studies.
Experience_Years: No explicit minimum years of professional experience are stated for this grant. For this program, the focus is on 'highly qualified doctoral candidates who are early in their academic/professional careers.'
Language_Certificate: German language ability is not a mandatory requirement for this grant. However, students must demonstrate language skills commensurate with their specific study and research needs.
Age: There is no fixed age limit for all DAAD scholarship programs. However, some programs may specify a maximum age (e.g., 32 years at the time of application) or a maximum time elapsed since the last degree was obtained. Applicants should check specific program guidelines.
Special_Circumstances: Research visits conducted outside Germany during the funding period should not exceed one quarter of the anticipated total funding period.
Career_Plan: While not explicitly listed as a separate document, a clear career plan is implicitly part of the overall application and project proposal.
Other_Requirements: Non-German citizenship and residence outside Germany are fundamental prerequisites.
Scholarship_Info: The DAAD Doctoral Programmes in Germany (Research Grants) scholarship is a prestigious offering from the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD). This program is designed to support international students and researchers wishing to pursue doctoral studies or conduct research projects in Germany. It provides a unique opportunity to complete a full doctoral degree or undertake a significant research project at a state or state-recognized German university. This scholarship program is funded by the German Federal Foreign Ministry. It aims to provide financial support for living expenses, research costs, and health insurance, enabling international students to pursue and complete a doctoral degree or conduct a research project in Germany.
Application_Documents:
Key documents include:
- DAAD application materials (typically submitted online via the DAAD portal).
- Recommendation letters and reference forms.
- Academic transcripts and degree certificates.
- Research proposal/study plan.
- Curriculum Vitae (CV).
- Proof of language proficiency (if applicable to the study/research needs).
Applicants may also need to print and submit copies of their DAAD application materials to their university's graduate school or a local DAAD office for priority consideration.

Funding_Details:
UKRI funds doctoral training by awarding training grants directly to research organisations (ROs), which then support studentships and recruit students. DTPs are flexible awards, providing funding to UK universities to support multiple studentships.
*   **Duration:** All DTP students must be funded at the minimum UKRI stipend level for at least three years and up to a maximum of four years. ESRC-funded PhD studentships through CAM-DTP specifically support 3.5 - 4.5 years of full-time study.
*   **Flexibility:**
    *   MRC DTPs offer significant flexibility in fund use, allowing ROs to align training with their scientific strategy. This includes the option to convert DTP studentships into iCASE studentships (jointly supported by industry) and providing an additional flexible supplement for unique training opportunities.
    *   EPSRC DTP funding offers flexibility for up to 10% of students starting in an academic year.
*   **Placements and Internships:**
    *   Funding for a three-month placement is embedded within the standard PhD model for ESRC studentships, with all studentships having access to three and a half years of funding.
    *   EPSRC DTP funding can support up to 15 Vacation Internships per year.
    *   The SWDTP offers a Placement Scheme for up to three months' work experience in a relevant UK-based partner organisation.
*   **Covered Expenses:**
    *   Tuition fees: Covered up to the national UKRI rate for Home students. For example, an UBEL DTP studentship for 2025/26 will cover tuition fees of £5006.
    *   Annual maintenance stipend: Provided at the minimum UKRI stipend level.
*   **Note for International Students:** While UKRI studentships are open to international students from the 2021-22 academic year onwards, they receive a Home rate DTP studentship. International students are welcome to apply but will need additional scholarships from alternative sources to fund the remainder of their fees (as many UK universities impose a higher fee for international students) and any immigration costs, including a health surcharge.
Quantity: NERC DTP1: 240 notional studentships per year; NERC DTP2: 235 notional studentships (2019-20 academic year); Southampton DTP: 45 studentships per year (5 standard, 4 iCASE)
Eligibility_Criteria:
**General Eligibility:**
*   **International Students:** UKRI studentships are open to international students from the 2021-22 academic year onwards. EU and EEA students are treated as international students unless they have pre-settled or settled status in the UK.
*   **Residential Eligibility:** DTPs and CDTs follow strict internal processes and UK government regulations in determining residential eligibility.
**Academic Requirements:**
*   **Minimum Degree:**
    *   NINE DTP: Applicants must have completed an undergraduate degree.
    *   ESRC: To receive ESRC studentship funding, applicants must have qualifications or experience equal to an honours degree at a first or upper second class level, or a masters from a UK academic research organisation. If a candidate does not meet these specific ESRC criteria, they are treated as an international student.
    *   E4-DTP: Normally requires a minimum of a 2.1 undergraduate degree or equivalent.
    *   Brunel DTP: A Masters degree is normally expected.
*   **Minimum GPA/Classification:** First or upper second class honours degree (for ESRC); minimum 2.1 undergraduate degree or equivalent (for E4-DTP).
**Experience Requirements:**
*   **Relevant Work Experience:** Relevant work experience may be considered, particularly for DTPs like E4-DTP, as an alternative or supplement to academic qualifications.
**Test Requirements (Language Proficiency):**
*   **IELTS/TOEFL:**
    *   Brunel DTP: Minimum IELTS 7 for international students.
    *   MRC TMRP DTP: Minimum IELTS score of 6.5 overall or TOEFL (iBT) 90, with each component meeting the minimum requirement of IELTS 5.5.
Eligible_Fields: Biology, Medicine, Environmental sciences, Astronomy, Physics
Eligible_Field_Group: Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences, Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology, Economics & Business, Law & Public Policy, Social Services & Care, Healthcare & Medicine, Agriculture & Environment
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Master's degree, PhD
Min_Gpa: First or upper second class honours degree (ESRC); minimum 2.1 undergraduate degree or equivalent (E4-DTP)
Experience_Years: Relevant work experience may be considered (E4-DTP)
Language_Certificate: IELTS 7 (Brunel DTP); IELTS 6.5 overall or TOEFL (iBT) 90 (MRC TMRP DTP)
Special_Circumstances:
*   **Studentship Extension:** AHRC-funded students may be eligible to apply for an extension to their studentship and AHRC submission deadline on the grounds of individual training or research needs, or to undertake a professional placement.
*   **Sick Pay and Medical Absence:** Provision for sick pay and medical absence is available with a Doctor's Note for DTPs such as OOCDTP and CAM-DTP. Students should contact their DTP or relevant university department to inform them of medical absence and submit evidence.
Other_Requirements:
*   **Open Access Policy:** AHRC-funded students are expected to follow UKRI’s open access policy when publishing their doctoral research, both during and after the funded period.
*   **UKRI Referencing:** Reference to UKRI must be made in any written text such as press releases or published documents related to the funded research.
Scholarship_Info: UKRI Doctoral Training Partnerships (DTPs) are a primary mechanism through which UKRI and its seven research councils (Arts and Humanities Research Council - AHRC, Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council - BBSRC, Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council - EPSRC, Economic and Social Research Council - ESRC, Medical Research Council - MRC, Natural Environment Research Council - NERC, and Science and Technology Facilities Council - STFC) fund doctoral training in UK universities. DTPs provide grants to research organisations (ROs) and consortia, which then offer high-quality, coherent postgraduate training and recruit students to these studentships. These are flexible awards designed to support multiple studentships aligned with the RO's scientific strategy and strengths.
Application_Documents: All proposals under UKRI calls, including DTP recommissioning, must be completed and submitted through UKRI's Joint Electronic Submissions (Je-S) system. Specific DTPs may require additional documents.
Timeline: 22nd January 2025 : Exeter NERC CDT studentship competition and application system closing date; 25th March 2025 : UKRI webpage mentioned closing date; 1st May 2025 : MRC Stage two round eight opening date; 16th July 2025 : MRC Stage two round eight closing date

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The comprehensive funding package covers:
*   Full tuition fees
*   Living costs
*   Return flights to and from the UK
*   A monthly stipend to cover living expenses, including accommodation, food, and personal costs
*   Additional expenses such as phone bills, daily travel, and any required course resources.
Quantity: Globally: 1,500-1,800 scholars selected annually from over 160 countries
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be outstanding emerging leaders and talented professionals identified as potential future leaders. Scholars are required to return to their country of origin for two years after completing their studies, making them ineligible for Graduate or other visas to remain in the UK for post-study work. Employees, former employees, or relatives of His Majesty’s Government (including the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office, all British Embassies/High Commissions, the Home Office, the Ministry of Defence, the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy, the Department for International Trade, and the UKVI), the British Council, a sponsoring UK university, or a staff member of the Association of Commonwealth Universities are generally ineligible if the employment took place within the last two years from the opening of Chevening applications. Employees, former employees, or relatives of Chevening Partner organisations are eligible to apply, but they cannot receive a Chevening partner award from the organisation they are affiliated with if the employment occurred within the last two years. Eligible courses must be full-time, taught master's programmes, lead to a master's degree, start in autumn, not be part-time or less than 9 months in duration, and be based in any accredited UK university. Applicants must possess a bachelor's degree or equivalent. A minimum of two years (2,800 hours) of work experience is required, including full-time employment, part-time employment, voluntary work, and paid or unpaid internships. Chevening no longer requires a separate English test score, but applicants must meet their chosen UK university's English language requirements. There is no upper age limit, and gender is not a factor in eligibility.
Min_Gpa: Not specified by Chevening; university admission may require a 3.5+ GPA, though lower GPAs (e.g., 2.92 or 3.06 out of 5) are not impossible.
Experience_Years: A minimum of two years of work experience is required.
Min_Working_Hours: 2,800 hours of work experience is required.
Language_Certificate: Not required by Chevening, but may be required by chosen UK university.
Special_Circumstances: Scholars are required to return to their country of origin for two years after completing their studies, making them ineligible for Graduate or other visas to remain in the UK for post-study work. The scholarship may be rescinded, and applicants banned from applying for up to five years, for certain breaches of terms and conditions. There are implied "exceptional circumstances" for failing to participate in optional events after confirming attendance, though these are not explicitly detailed.
Career_Plan: Applicants are expected to reflect on their goals and values, create clear short, medium, and long-term plans, and articulate specifically how the Chevening Scholarship fits into their career trajectory.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are required to submit two reference letters. If an applicant advances to the interview stage, these letters must be provided by the interview date. Reference letters should detail: 1) How long the referee has known the applicant, and 2) In what capacity the referee knows the applicant. Applications must be submitted online through Chevening’s online application system. It is not a requirement to apply to course choices before submitting the Chevening application. Changes to a submitted application are limited to personal data and do not include modifications to essays, course choices, or work experience details.
Scholarship_Info: The Chevening Scholarship is the UK Government's prestigious global scholarship programme, enabling outstanding emerging leaders from all over the world to pursue one-year master’s degrees in the United Kingdom. It is designed for talented professionals identified as potential future leaders across a wide range of fields. Beyond the Standard Chevening Scholarships, the programme also offers specialised awards such as Chevening SIDS Scholarships and Chevening ASEAN Scholarships.
Application_Documents: Required application components include answering eligibility questions, submitting essays, detailing course choices, providing work experience information, and securing two reference letters. The entire application process is conducted online.
Timeline:
2025-08-05 12:00 UTC : Application cycle opened
2025-10-07 12:00 UTC/GMT : Application deadline
mid-October 2025 : Selection process, including interviews, commences
June 2026 : Successful applicants for the 2026-27 academic year announced
autumn of 2026 : UK studies commence

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
The MAECI Italian Government Scholarships are generally described as fully funded, offering comprehensive financial and academic support. Grants and contributions are available to successful applicants.
Covered Expenses typically include:
* Tuition fees
* Living expenses
* Airfare (mentioned as a benefit in some contexts)
For specific programs, such as 3-month Italian language and culture courses, a grant of €3,000 is provided. It is important for applicants to ensure their scholarship letter or document explicitly mentions the coverage of living expenses.
Eligibility_Criteria: Open to foreign citizens living abroad and Italian citizens residing abroad (IRE). International students not residing in Italy are specifically eligible. Applicants must be deserving students who meet specific academic, age, and language criteria, along with other requirements defined in the official call by the MAECI.
Eligible_Fields: Economics, Fine arts, Visual Arts, Music and performing arts, Language acquisition, Literature and linguistics
Eligible_Field_Group: Economics & Business, Arts, Design & Media, Humanities & Social Sciences, Natural Sciences, Engineering & Technology
Required_Degree: High School Diploma, Bachelor's degree, Master's degree
Experience_Years: No minimum years of experience are specified.
Language_Certificate: Italian B2 (for Italian-taught courses), Italian A2 (for Italian Language and Culture Courses), English B2 (for English-taught courses)
Age: Bachelor's Degree programs: <= 23 years old; Master’s Degree programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, and Italian Language and Culture advanced Courses: 18-28 years old; PhD programs: <= 30 years old
Special_Circumstances: Italian citizens residing abroad (IRE) are eligible.
Other_Requirements: PhD Program Acceptance: Applicants for PhD programs are required to provide a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University. Motivation: Academic merit and motivation are key factors in the selection process. Renewal: The scholarship can be renewed for the subsequent academic year, provided students meet specific performance requirements. Incompatibility: The MAECI grant is strictly incompatible with any other grant offered by the Italian Government or any other Italian public institution, including DSU grants.
Scholarship_Info: The MAECI Italian Government Scholarships are a prestigious initiative offered by the Italian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation (MAECI). These scholarships are designed to support international students and Italian citizens residing abroad (IRE) in pursuing higher education, advanced training, and research in Italy. The program aims to foster international cooperation in cultural, scientific, and technological fields, promote the Italian language and culture, support Italy’s economic system globally, strengthen academic cooperation, and allow students to experience Italy’s rich academic and cultural heritage. The scholarships provide financial and academic support, making higher education in Italy more accessible across various disciplines.
Application_Documents: Candidates are typically required to prepare and submit a comprehensive set of documents to support their eligibility and qualifications. This usually includes evidence of previous academic credentials (transcripts, diplomas) and language proficiency certificates (Italian or English). A strong CV with experiences and extracurricular activities is highly recommended. For PhD programs, a letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University is required.
Timeline:
Applications for the 2025-2026 academic year are now open.
2026-01-15 : Study Application Deadline (for study programs at Italian universities/institutes).
February 2026 : Scholarship Application (via email invitation).
Final rankings of scholarship recipients are published by MAECI.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The fellowships are granted for a four-year duration, offering young researchers the opportunity to prepare and complete their PhD.
A fixed bench fee of €3,720 per fellowship year is provided to cover research-related costs.
Full reimbursement of travel card costs for commuting to and from work by public transport (train, tram, bus, metro) is included.
The fellowship does not cover expenditures already financed by other sources, nor does it cover the costs of other scholarship students, PhD students, postdoctoral fellows, or staff.
Quantity: Past call: 313 (fundamental research), 179 (Strategic Basic Research). FWO generally funds 850 basic research fellows per year across programs.
Eligibility_Criteria: Supports researchers who have recently graduated and aim to pursue an independent PhD fundamental research project. Open to young and promising researchers/early-stage researchers. Candidates must have obtained or be in the process of obtaining a master's degree. Applicants must not have completed a PhD prior to applying. The fellowships are open to researchers of any nationality.
Experience_Years: No specific minimum years of experience are required. The program is designed for "recently graduated" and "early-stage researchers."
Language_Certificate: No specific IELTS, TOEFL, or other language certificates are explicitly mentioned as a requirement.
Special_Circumstances: The FWO also offers a distinct "Special PhD fellowship" which enables individuals not currently employed within scientific research to complete a PhD within one year. This is a separate program from the main four-year doctoral fellowships.
Other_Requirements: Candidates must be affiliated with a university in the Flemish Community or the Evangelical Protestant Faculty. While not a general requirement, a minimum score of 4 (good) on interdisciplinarity is required to receive funding from specific panels. While not explicitly stated for the application, a certificate from the supervisor confirming the completion of the PhD for the duration of the fellowship may be required at later stages or for specific program variations.
Scholarship_Info: The FWO Doctoral Fellowships (Fundamental Research / SB) are four-year PhD fellowships provided by the FWO (Research Foundation – Flanders) to support early-stage researchers in their development into independent scientists. The program enables them to pursue an independent PhD project within the Flemish Community of Belgium, focusing on either Fundamental Research or Strategic Basic Research tracks.
Application_Documents: Detailed project proposal. An interim report is required after the fellowship has been awarded, providing an overview of the work carried out.
Timeline:
2024-12-05 : Opening Date
2025-03-03 : Application Deadline (5:00 PM CET)
2025-05-26 to 2025-06-11 : Online Preselection Meetings
2025-06-13 (approx.) : Results Announcement

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Tuition Waiver, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
These grants offer comprehensive financial support, funding predoctoral contracts for a duration of three to four years. The funding includes a monthly salary for the doctoral candidate, typically ranging between €1,300 and €1,800. The annual grant amount is approximately 17,785 euros, with a potential increase to 19,000 euros for a fourth year if the contract transitions to a postdoctoral phase.

Covered expenses include:
*   Predoctoral contracts for PhD training.
*   Monthly salary for the researcher.
*   Tuition costs associated with the doctoral program.
*   Costs related to the completion of training activities, which may include mobility for training stays.
Eligibility_Criteria:
Nationality:
*   FPI: Open to applicants of all nationalities.
*   FPU: Generally restricted to applicants holding Spanish or any EU country nationality.
Academic Status: Applicants must hold a university degree and be either enrolled or pre-admitted to a doctoral program at a Spanish university. They must have completed their degree(s) prior to application.
Academic Performance: For FPU grants, a strong academic record is often required, with applicants typically encouraged to have a GPA of approximately 80% or higher.
Experience_Years: Relevant work or research experience is considered beneficial and is often requested as part of the application documentation, particularly for FPI calls (e.g., FPI ICIQ).
Scholarship_Info: The FPI/FPU Predoctoral Grants are a prestigious scholarship program in Spain designed to support doctoral candidates. FPI (Formación de Personal Investigador) and FPU (Formación de Profesorado Universitario) are distinct but related programs. They are primarily provided by the Spanish Ministry of Science and Innovation (FPI) and the Ministry of Education and Vocational Training (FPU). Both programs aim to foster research training within doctoral programs in Spain, enabling recipients to obtain a Doctor title and acquire university teaching skills, thereby facilitating their incorporation into the Spanish higher education and scientific research system.
Application_Documents: A full Curriculum Vitae (in PDF format) is a mandatory application document, which should include academic background, work or research experience, and publications.

September 25 : IEB FPI application deadline

November 30 : ETSi US.es FPI application deadline
January–February : FPU Calls open
January 17 to February 14 : UC3M FPU 2024 application period
February 14, 2025 : UGR FPU 2024 application deadline
January/February (following year) : Expected start date of employment for successful FPI candidates

Funding_Details: Recipients receive a monthly allowance of €1,181. Covered expenses include: International airfare (economy class transportation at the start of the program), Domestic travel support within France (bus/train), Health insurance, Assistance in locating housing, Participation in cultural activities, Return transportation (economy class) at the end of the program. Tuition fees are not covered.
Quantity: Approximately 350 scholarships are awarded each year across all Eiffel programs (Master's and PhD).
Eligibility_Criteria: Applicants must be international students (non-French citizenship). French nationals are not eligible. Candidates must be nominated by a French higher education institution after being accepted into a PhD program. The university is responsible for submitting the scholarship application on behalf of the student. Only candidates applying for the first time at the PhD level for the Eiffel scholarship are eligible. The scholarship is open to candidates already enrolled in a doctoral program, including those with joint supervision of a dissertation or dual degree arrangements.
Eligible_Fields: Biology, Medicine, Environmental sciences, Environmental protection technology, Climate Change Adaptation, Climate Change Mitigation, Mathematics, History and archaeology, Language acquisition, Literature and linguistics, Law, Political sciences and civics, Economics, Management and administration
Eligible_Field_Group: Natural Sciences, Healthcare & Medicine, Agriculture & Environment, Engineering & Technology, IT & Data Science, Humanities & Social Sciences, Law & Public Policy, Economics & Business
Min_Gpa: 3.5/4.0 or higher, or an average grade of at least 15/20 over the last three academic years
Language_Certificate: Not a mandatory requirement for the scholarship itself; specific language requirements (French or English) must be confirmed with the chosen French higher education institution.
Age: Up to 35 years old (born after March 31st, 1990)
Special_Circumstances: Applicants currently studying in France are eligible but do not receive priority. For joint PhD or co-supervision arrangements, the scholarship covers stays in France, with a minimum stay of 6 months over a maximum period of 3 years.
Career_Plan: While not explicitly listed as a direct scholarship application requirement for the student, a career plan is typically an integral part of the university admission process. Candidates should prepare this document for their university application.
Other_Requirements: Reference Letters: While not explicitly listed as direct scholarship application requirements for the student, reference letters are typically integral parts of the university admission process. Candidates should prepare these documents for their university application.
Scholarship_Info: The Eiffel Excellence Scholarship Program (Doctorate) is a prestigious scholarship initiative established by the French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs. Its primary objective is to enable French higher education institutions to attract top international students to enroll in their Master's and PhD programs. The scholarship facilitates study in France, supporting the country's goal of fostering academic excellence and international collaboration.
Application_Documents: Specific documents are required for university admission (e.g., academic transcripts, CV, research proposal, letters of recommendation). Candidates should prepare these thoroughly for their chosen institution, which will then use them to build the scholarship application.
Timeline: October 2025 : Application Opening Date, January 8, 2026 : Application Deadline (Campus France). Note: French higher education institutions typically set earlier internal deadlines for prospective students to submit their applications for nomination. Candidates must adhere to the specific deadlines of their chosen French institution.

Funding_Details: The FRIA and FRESH Doctoral Grants provide comprehensive funding for a 4-year doctoral program, structured as two successive scholarships. The first scholarship has a maximum duration of 27 months, offering a gross annual amount of €27,836.40. The second scholarship, for a maximum duration of 21 months, provides a gross annual amount of €29,158.56. The primary purpose of the FRIA scholarship is to enable the completion of a PhD within this 4-year timeframe. While core funding is a stipend, the F.R.S.-FNRS generally supports researchers through grants or fixed-term contracts, suggesting a broader support framework for research activities.
Eligibility_Criteria: The entry requirements for ASP, FRIA, and FRESH grants are aligned with those for third-cycle (doctoral) degree studies. FRESH scholarships are specifically intended for university graduates who aim to conduct basic research projects with high societal impact. ASP (Aspirant) fellowships are open to all international students. An applicant is ineligible for a FRIA Grant if they have previously received two F.R.S.-FNRS Research Fellow fellowships (ASP + ASP-REN) or two FRESH grants (1st + 2nd Grant). If an applicant has received a FRIA/FRESH grant, the duration of that grant will be deducted from the maximum possible duration under any other F.R.S.-FNRS fellowship.
Special_Circumstances: An applicant is ineligible for a FRIA Grant if they have previously received two F.R.S.-FNRS Research Fellow fellowships (ASP + ASP-REN) or two FRESH grants (1st + 2nd Grant). If an applicant has received a FRIA/FRESH grant, the duration of that grant will be deducted from the maximum possible duration under any other F.R.S.-FNRS fellowship.
Other_Requirements: Applicants are generally required to submit a reference letter from their promoter (supervisor) and additional reference letters from other reference persons. For FRIA grants, candidates are also required to possess a "second degree."
Scholarship_Info: The F.R.S.-FNRS Doctoral Fellowships, encompassing the FRIA, FRESH, and ASP grants, are prestigious doctoral funding opportunities provided by the Fund for Scientific Research (FRS–FNRS). These fellowships are specifically designed to support doctoral researchers in the French-speaking community of Belgium (Wallonia) in the preparation and presentation of a doctoral thesis. The F.R.S.-FNRS is a key employer of researchers in Belgium, offering either grants or fixed-term contracts for doctoral and postdoctoral stages.
Application_Documents: Appendices, Letter of support from the rector of the host university, Certificate or copy of the Ph.D. diploma and Minutes of the thesis defence (particularly for applicants who will not have their PhD by a specific validation date), 'Seal of Excellence Certificate', Accepted publications.
Timeline:
Once per year : Applications accepted
2025-07-02 : FRIA call opened (example for 2025)
October 1st : Grants and fellowships commence (often retroactive)
2023-12-12 : Recent award date for FRIA and FRESH Doctoral Grants
2022-12-13 : Recent award date for FRIA and FRESH Doctoral Grants

Funding_Details: The scholarship provides a monthly stipend of CHF 1,920.-. In addition to the stipend, covered expenses include mandatory Swiss health insurance for non-EU/EFTA awardees, partial tuition exemptions, and various practical benefits designed to facilitate the awardee's settlement in Switzerland.
Eligibility_Criteria: The PhD scholarship is primarily intended for talented early career researchers (ECRs) from abroad who have already completed a Master's degree. Candidates must hold a relevant Master's degree to pursue a doctoral degree in Switzerland. International students already holding a Master's or PhD degree in any field of study are eligible. Applicants who have previously received funding from a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are ineligible to apply for a second scholarship. Furthermore, applicants must be citizens of a country other than Switzerland.
Experience_Years: Emphasis on individuals at the beginning of their research careers post-Master's degree; no specific minimum years stated.
Language_Certificate: Proficiency in the language of instruction or research is mandatory. This includes German, French, Italian, or English. Applicants must be able to demonstrate proficiency in English or, depending on the specific program and host institution, other relevant languages.
Special_Circumstances: Previous recipients of a Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship are not eligible to reapply.
Other_Requirements:
A Letter of Recommendation is a required component of the application.
Applicants must demonstrate leadership, community involvement, and academic excellence.
A high-quality, original, and feasible research proposal is required. This proposal must consist of seven distinct parts and align with the host institution's expertise and the Swiss research environment.
Candidates are responsible for arranging their own affiliations with a host professor who is willing to supervise their research. This supervisor must be at one of the eligible Swiss public universities, Federal Institutes of Technology, Universities of Applied Sciences, or Schools of Music and Arts.
An academic supervisor at a Swiss university is a mandatory requirement for all scholarship applications.
Integration into the host research team is expected.
Scholarship_Info: The Swiss Government Excellence Scholarships (PhD) program is a prestigious initiative funded by the State Secretariat for Education, Research and Innovation (SERI) under the Swiss Confederation. It aims to foster international exchange and research cooperation between Switzerland and over 180 other countries. The scholarships are specifically designed for talented early career researchers from abroad who wish to pursue doctoral studies in Switzerland. They enable selected applicants to undertake postgraduate research as part of their doctoral studies or to pursue a full PhD at a Swiss higher education institution or recognized research institute.
Application_Documents:
A full Curriculum Vitae (CV) with a list of academic publications and awards.
A comprehensive research proposal, structured into seven specific parts.
A Letter of Recommendation.
A letter of support from a host supervisor at a Swiss university or recognized research institute.
Timeline:
September - December 2025 : Application deadline (exact date depends on Swiss Embassy)
12 months : Initial scholarship duration
Up to 36 months : Maximum scholarship duration (conditional renewal)
